questions.question: How does Charlie react to the ink blot test and the Thematic Apperception test?

choices.answer: Charlie thought they were interesting.
Charlie liked taking the tests.
Charlie was afraid he failed the tests.
Charlie wondered how many time he would take them.

questions.question: Why does Charlie have a rabbit’s foot in his pocket?

choices.answer: Charlie liked the feel and color of it.
Miss Kinnian gave him the foot and he cherished it.
Charlie liked collecting weird things.
This was Charlie's good luck charm.

questions.question: Why did Charlie go to night school?  What does that tell you about him?

choices.answer: Charlie's mom said it would be a good thing to do.
Charlie asked some people where the school was.
All his life Charlie wanted to be smart & not dumb.
Charlie had friends who attended night school.

questions.question: What was the goal of the operation?

choices.answer: The goal was to triple Charlie's intelligence.
The goal was to make smarter people even smarter.
The goal was to stop Charlie from having seizures.
Dr. Nemur wanted to make an intellectual superman.

questions.question: Immediately after the operation, Charlie is disappointed because...

choices.answer: He cannot visit his family.
He hears the doctors arguing about their hopes for Charlie.
He doesn't feel any smarter.
He cannot see Miss Kinnian.

questions.question: Why does Dr. Strauss say they should use Charlie for the experiment?

choices.answer: Charlie is good natured, interested, and eager to please.
Charlie is dull, apathetic, and hard to reach.
Miss Kinnian tells him Charlie is her best student.
Dr. Nemur wanted to use an intellectually disabled person.

questions.question: Why did Dr. Strauss originally want Charlie to write everything down in progress reports?

choices.answer: There were many applicants and Dr. Strauss wanted the best.
He wanted to get an overall picture of who Charlie was.
To give Charlie something to do while gaining intelligence.
He wanted Charlie’s thoughts on the entire procedure.

questions.question: Charlie didn't want to "tell lies about people" in the TAT tells you what about him?

choices.answer: Charlie's perspective
Charlie's way of thinking and reasoning
Charlie is changing
Charlie's motivation

questions.question: What is the format and point of view used for "Flowers for Algernon"?

choices.answer: 1st person point of view and interview format.
Journal format and 1st person point of view.
Journal style and 2nd person point of view.
Story format and 3rd person point of view.

questions.question: The story is divided into progress reports in order of date to...

choices.answer: Track Charlie’s thoughts & progress before & after surgery
Show Charlie is can't think of chapter titles before surgery
Help Charlie keep track of different reports for the doctors
Tell Charlie's story from different POV's

questions.question: Best describes Charlie Gordon.

choices.answer: A 37-year old intellectually disabled man.
Highly motivated and wants to learn.
Miss Kinnian's "bestist" pupil.
Excited and wants to try really hard to be smart.

questions.question: “I said why shud I make up lies...I always get caut.” What does this tell you about Charlie?

choices.answer: He can't afford the surgery so he pretends to be less smart
He is impatient because there are so many tests to take
He is depressed because he has had failures all his life
Lacks imagination; he connects storytelling with lying.

questions.question: Burt shows Charlie the inkblots after his surgery, and this time Charlie reacts by

choices.answer: Questioning just how feeble-minded he was before the surgery
Getting mad at Burt for treating him like a child
Analyzing the pictures and lying to Burt about what he saw
Throwing the cards on the floor and refusing to participate

questions.question: “As if he’d hidden this part of himself to deceive me..." tells what about Charlie's thinking?

choices.answer: Charlie wishes to be more like he was before the operation.
Charlie is more suspicious & paranoid as he grew smarter.
Charlie has discovered that smart people never pretend.
Charlie no longer believes that doctors are smart people.

questions.question: Why does Charlie leave the factory?

choices.answer: Dr. Strauss and Dr. Nemur want him to live at the lab.
He believes that he is too smart to work in a factory
His coworkers are afraid of Charlie & his quick intelligence
He wants to spend all his time reading & listening to music

questions.question: Why does Fanny not sign the petition to have Charlie fired?

choices.answer: Fanny had been fired from a job & knew how Charlie felt
Fanny likes Charlie
Fanny disliked Joe Carp and Frank Reilly
Fanny was against the petition on principle

questions.question: Why is Charlie alarmed when Algernon’s behavior changes?

choices.answer: He's  angry that he can't make Algernon’s intelligence last
He's afraid because  the same thing will happen to him
Algernon is his one true friend & he's now mean to Charlie
He's worried others won't like him like Algernon did

questions.question: Which incident horrified Charlie the most?

choices.answer: When he laughed at & made fun of a mentally challenged man
When he told Miss Kinnian he didn’t like her anymore
He learned Dr.s weren’t so smart & he was smarter than them
When he learned what “pulling a Charlie Gordon” meant

questions.question: Why is Charlie motivated to publish the results despite the failure of the operation?

choices.answer: It shows the world he was brave enough to try the experiment
To encourage the scientific world to help people like him
Disproving a theory is as important as proving the theory
He wants to embarrass Dr. Nemur because Dr. Nemur was wrong

questions.question: Why does Charlie take books with him when he leaves town in the end?

choices.answer: He wants a memory of his attempt to get smarter
He plans on going to night school, and he needs books
To prove to others he once was able to read these hard books
He wants to try hard to be smart like before the operation

questions.question: At the end of the story, Charlie…(NOT what you think happens, but how the story ends…)

choices.answer: Dies
Leave New York
Can no longer walk
Does not know who he is

questions.question: What Charlie feels the first time he beats Algernon in a race

choices.answer: shame
pride
hope
confusion

questions.question: What Charlie feels when he sees people making fun of the dishwasher

choices.answer: love
sadness
Shame
fear

questions.question: What Charlie feels toward Miss Kinnian

choices.answer: anger
fear
hope
love

questions.question: What Charlie feels just before the operation

choices.answer: confusion
pride
anger
fear

questions.question: What Charlie feels when he realizes what it means to “pull a Charlie Gordon”

choices.answer: shame
sadness
confusion
fear

questions.question: What Charlie feels when he realizes he is getting too smart for Miss Kinnian

choices.answer: love
anger
sadness
fear

questions.question: What Charlie loses when he realizes his fate will be the same as Algernon’s

choices.answer: confusion
fear
shame
anger

questions.question: Who said this "At werst you will have it for a little wile and your doing something for sience”

choices.answer: Dr. Strauss
Joe
Miss Kinnian
Fanny

questions.question: Who said this: “Look at how well hes lerned to read and write...I say we use him"

choices.answer: Dr. Nemur
Dr. Strauss
Miss Kinnian
Frank

questions.question: Who said this: “It was evil when Eve listened to the snake and ate from the tree of knowledge"

choices.answer: Miss Kinnian
Frank
Joe
Fanny

questions.question: Who said this: "...leave him alone you lousy cracker or Ill break your neck"

choices.answer: Fanny
Miss Kinnian
Joe
Dr. Strauss

questions.question: Who said this: "Even a feeble-minded man wants to be like other men.”

choices.answer: Charlie
Miss Kinnian
Fanny
Frank

questions.question: What is the purpose of the TV that Dr. Strauss gave to Charlie?

choices.answer: To help Charlie sleep
To teach things to Charlie's subconscious mind
To give Charlie something to watch at night
To give Charlie positive thoughts while he slept

questions.question: What happened to Charlie when he went out with Joe and Frank?

choices.answer: He got drunk
He learned what it meant to "pull a Charlie Gordon"
He got beat up
He felt shame

questions.question: Which of these explain the Gordon-Algernon Effect?

choices.answer: The rate of increase is equal to the rate of decrease
The amount of increase is proportional to rate of decrease
The rate of increase is more than the rate of decrease
The amount of increase is less than the rate of decrease
